key.name: session-start
key.description: Unix time of the start of the current session.

key.name: auto-save-session
key.description: If enabled, ukui-session will save the session automatically.

key.name: logout-prompt
key.description: If enabled, ukui-session will prompt the user before ending a session.

key.name: logout-timeout
key.description: If logout prompt is enabled, this set the timeout in seconds before logout automatically. If 0, automatic logout is disabled.

key.name: idle-delay
key.summary: Time before session is considered idle
key.description: The number of minutes of inactivity before the session is considered idle.

key.name: default-session
key.description: List of applications that are part of the default session.

key.name: required-components-list
key.description: List of components that are required as part of the session. (Each element names a key under "/org/ukui/desktop/session/required_components"). The Startup Applications preferences tool will not normally allow users to remove a required component from the session, and the session manager will automatically add the required components back to the session at login time if they do get removed.

key.name: gnome-compat-startup
key.description: Control which compatibility components to start.

key.name: windowmanager
key.description: The window manager is the program that draws the title bar and borders around windows, and allows you to move and resize windows.

key.name: panel
key.description: The panel provides the bar at the top or bottom of the screen containing menus, the window list, status icons, the clock, etc.

key.name: filemanager
key.description: The file manager provides the desktop icons and allows you to interact with your saved files.
